items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the River Windrush following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24, especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. 
Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling today but levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
Ginge Brook
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the Ginge Brook in Steventon. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24. Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to remain high over the next days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but falling on the River Ray. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24, especially in the Islip area. Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to continue gradually falling over the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but falling on the River Thames following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24, especially between Cricklade and Hannington Bridge. Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling over the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now starting to fall on the River Thame. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24, especially in the Stadhampton and Dorchester areas. Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days, but will continue to slowly fall. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
Tern and Perry catchments
items.message:
River levels remain high but are steady at the Tern - Walcot river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem and Rodington.   

We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 29/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but stable on the River Dikler. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 28/10/24. 
Monday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 29/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leach from Northleach to Mill Lane near Lechlade
River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.      
We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.   
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.     

No significant rainfall is forecast for the next 48 hours. Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.   

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Expected rainfall overnight including some heavy showers, may cause local watercourses in the area to rise. Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible when river levels are at their highest between 7:30PM on 27/10/2024 and 9:00AM on 28/10/2024.

Areas most at risk include Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to remain high and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No further rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.

items.description: River Ebble and tributaries
items.message:
High river levels throughout the afternoon may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible from 12:00 noon on 25/10/2024.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Ebble, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alvediston and Nunton.
Further flooding is possible throughout the afternoon as river levels continue to remain high due to raised groundwater levels.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 3:00 PM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.

items.description: River Stour in Worcestershire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.      
We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.

items.description: Dragley Beck at Ulverston from Dragley Beck Bridge on Well Lane downstream to South Ulverston
items.message:
Due to the recent heavy rainfall, flooding in the area is expected from 2:00 AM on 28/10/2024 and expect a peak at 02:45 AM.  Areas most at risk include low lying areas and property adjacent to Dragley and Lund Becks at Rydal Road, Watery Lane, Fitz Bridge, Morecambe Road, Rope Walk and parts of South Ulverston at Low Mill Bridge, South View Farm and Outcast.

Weather conditions are expected to improve from around 07:00 this morning 28/10/24.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  Be aware of local water levels and weather conditions. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Town Beck at Ulverston from The Gill downstream to The Ellers area
items.message:
River levels are rising due to heavy rainfall and flooding is expected from 3:00AM on 28/10/2024.

Areas most at risk include low-lying areas and properties in the town adjacent to Town Beck.  Areas likely to be affected are The Gill, parts of Upper Brook Street, Buxton Place, Union Street, The Ellers area and the Recycling Centre.

Weather conditions are expected to improve this morning from 07:00AM on the 28/10/24.

We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing debris from weed screens.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Town Beck at Ulverston from The Ellers to Dragley Beck
items.message:
River levels are rising due to heavy rainfall and flooding is expected from 3:00AM on 28/10/2024.

Areas most at risk include the Allotment Gardens, Lund Terrace, Morecambe Road, North Lonsdale Terrace, Kingsway, Dale Street and William Street.

Weather conditions are expected to improve from 07:00AM on the 28/10/24.

We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing debris from weed screens.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Dragley and Lunds Becks at South Ulverston
items.message:
River levels are rising due to heavy rainfall overnight and flooding is expected.  Weather conditions are expected to improve from 07:00AM on the 28/10/24.

Areas most at risk include low lying areas and property adjacent to Dragley and Lund Becks at South Ulverston, including Steel Street, North Lonsdale Road, Cross Lane and Kennedy Street areas.

We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing debris from weed screens.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.
